00024 /*
00025  * Video Acceleration (VA) API Specification
00026  *
00027  * Rev. 0.30
00028  * <jonathan.bian@intel.com>
00029  *
00030  * Revision History:
00031  * rev 0.10 (12/10/2006 Jonathan Bian) - Initial draft
00032  * rev 0.11 (12/15/2006 Jonathan Bian) - Fixed some errors
00033  * rev 0.12 (02/05/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added VC-1 data structures for slice level decode
00034  * rev 0.13 (02/28/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added GetDisplay()
00035  * rev 0.14 (04/13/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Fixed MPEG-2 PictureParameter structure, cleaned up a few funcs.
00036  * rev 0.15 (04/20/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Overhauled buffer management
00037  * rev 0.16 (05/02/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added error codes and fixed some issues with configuration
00038  * rev 0.17 (05/07/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added H.264/AVC data structures for slice level decode.
00039  * rev 0.18 (05/14/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added data structures for MPEG-4 slice level decode 
00040  *                                       and MPEG-2 motion compensation.
00041  * rev 0.19 (08/06/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Removed extra type for bitplane data.
00042  * rev 0.20 (08/08/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added missing fields to VC-1 PictureParameter structure.
00043  * rev 0.21 (08/20/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added image and subpicture support.
00044  * rev 0.22 (08/27/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added support for chroma-keying and global alpha.
00045  * rev 0.23 (09/11/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Fixed some issues with images and subpictures.
00046  * rev 0.24 (09/18/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added display attributes.
00047  * rev 0.25 (10/18/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Changed to use IDs only for some types.
00048  * rev 0.26 (11/07/2007 Waldo Bastian) - Change vaCreateBuffer semantics
00049  * rev 0.27 (11/19/2007 Matt Sottek)   - Added DeriveImage
00050  * rev 0.28 (12/06/2007 Jonathan Bian) - Added new versions of PutImage and AssociateSubpicture 
00051  *                                       to enable scaling
00052  * rev 0.29 (02/07/2008 Jonathan Bian) - VC1 parameter fixes,
00053  *                                       added VA_STATUS_ERROR_RESOLUTION_NOT_SUPPORTED
00054  * rev 0.30 (03/01/2009 Jonathan Bian) - Added encoding support for H.264 BP and MPEG-4 SP and fixes
00055  *                                       for ISO C conformance.
00056  * rev 0.31 (09/02/2009 Gwenole Beauchesne) - VC-1/H264 fields change for VDPAU and XvBA backend
00057  *                                       Application needs to relink with the new library.
00058  *
00059  * rev 0.31.1 (03/29/2009)              - Data structure for JPEG encode
00060  * rev 0.31.2 (01/13/2011 Anthony Pabon)- Added a flag to indicate Subpicture coordinates are screen
00061  *                                        screen relative rather than source video relative.
00062  * rev 0.32.0 (01/13/2011 Xiang Haihao) - Add profile into VAPictureParameterBufferVC1
00063  *                                        update VAAPI to 0.32.0
00064  *
00065  * Acknowledgements:
00066  *  Some concepts borrowed from XvMC and XvImage.
00067  *  Waldo Bastian (Intel), Matt Sottek (Intel),  Austin Yuan (Intel), and Gwenole Beauchesne (SDS)
00068  *  contributed to various aspects of the API.
00069  */

00110 /* 
00111 Overview 
00112 
00113 The VA API is intended to provide an interface between a video decode/encode/display
00114 application (client) and a hardware accelerator (server), to off-load 
00115 video decode/encode/display operations from the host to the hardware accelerator at various 
00116 entry-points.
00117 
00118 The basic operation steps are:
00119 
00120 - Negotiate a mutually acceptable configuration with the server to lock
00121   down profile, entrypoints, and other attributes that will not change on 
00122   a frame-by-frame basis.
00123 - Create a decode context which represents a "virtualized" hardware decode 
00124   device
00125 - Get and fill decode buffers with picture level, slice level and macroblock 
00126   level data (depending on entrypoints)
00127 - Pass the decode buffers to the server to decode the current frame
00128 
00129 Initialization & Configuration Management 
00130 
00131 - Find out supported profiles
00132 - Find out entrypoints for a given profile
00133 - Find out configuration attributes for a given profile/entrypoint pair
00134 - Create a configuration for use by the decoder
00135 
00136 */
00137 
00138 typedef void* VADisplay;        /* window system dependent */
00139 
00140 typedef int VAStatus;   /* Return status type from functions */
00141 /* Values for the return status */
00142 #define VA_STATUS_SUCCESS                       0x00000000
00143 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_OPERATION_FAILED        0x00000001
00144 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_ALLOCATION_FAILED       0x00000002
00145 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_DISPLAY         0x00000003
00146 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_CONFIG          0x00000004
00147 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_CONTEXT         0x00000005
00148 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_SURFACE         0x00000006
00149 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_BUFFER          0x00000007
00150 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_IMAGE           0x00000008
00151 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_SUBPICTURE      0x00000009
00152 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_ATTR_NOT_SUPPORTED      0x0000000a
00153 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_MAX_NUM_EXCEEDED        0x0000000b
00154 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PROFILE     0x0000000c
00155 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ENTRYPOINT  0x0000000d
00156 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_RT_FORMAT   0x0000000e
00157 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_BUFFERTYPE  0x0000000f
00158 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_SURFACE_BUSY            0x00000010
00159 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_FLAG_NOT_SUPPORTED      0x00000011
00160 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER       0x00000012
00161 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_RESOLUTION_NOT_SUPPORTED 0x00000013
00162 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNIMPLEMENTED           0x00000014
00163 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_SURFACE_IN_DISPLAYING   0x00000015
00164 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT    0x00000016
00165 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_DECODING_ERROR          0x00000017
00166 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_ENCODING_ERROR          0x00000018
00167 
00174 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE           0x00000019
00175 #define VA_STATUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN                 0xFFFFFFFF
00176 
00177 /* De-interlacing flags for vaPutSurface() */
00178 #define VA_FRAME_PICTURE        0x00000000 
00179 #define VA_TOP_FIELD            0x00000001
00180 #define VA_BOTTOM_FIELD         0x00000002
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * Enabled the positioning/cropping/blending feature:
00184  * 1, specify the video playback position in the isurface
00185  * 2, specify the cropping info for video playback
00186  * 3, encoded video will blend with background color
00187  */
00188 #define VA_ENABLE_BLEND         0x00000004 /* video area blend with the constant color */ 
00189     
00190 /*
00191  * Clears the drawable with background color.
00192  * for hardware overlay based implementation this flag
00193  * can be used to turn off the overlay
00194  */
00195 #define VA_CLEAR_DRAWABLE       0x00000008
00196 
00197 /* Color space conversion flags for vaPutSurface() */
00198 #define VA_SRC_BT601            0x00000010
00199 #define VA_SRC_BT709            0x00000020
00200 #define VA_SRC_SMPTE_240        0x00000040
00201 
00202 /* Scaling flags for vaPutSurface() */
00203 #define VA_FILTER_SCALING_DEFAULT       0x00000000
00204 #define VA_FILTER_SCALING_FAST          0x00000100
00205 #define VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ            0x00000200
00206 #define VA_FILTER_SCALING_NL_ANAMORPHIC 0x00000300
00207 #define VA_FILTER_SCALING_MASK          0x00000f00

00210  * Returns a short english description of error_status
00211  */
00212 const char *vaErrorStr(VAStatus error_status);

00214 /*
00215  * Initialization:
00216  * A display must be obtained by calling vaGetDisplay() before calling
00217  * vaInitialize() and other functions. This connects the API to the 
00218  * native window system.
00219  * For X Windows, native_dpy would be from XOpenDisplay()
00220  */
00221 typedef void* NativeDisplay;    /* window system dependent */
00222 
00223 int vaDisplayIsValid(VADisplay dpy);

00232 );

00235  * After this call, all library internal resources will be cleaned up

00238     VADisplay dpy
00239 );

00241 /*
00242  * vaQueryVendorString returns a pointer to a zero-terminated string
00243  * describing some aspects of the VA implemenation on a specific    
00244  * hardware accelerator. The format of the returned string is vendor
00245  * specific and at the discretion of the implementer.
00246  * e.g. for the Intel GMA500 implementation, an example would be:
00247  * "Intel GMA500 - 2.0.0.32L.0005"
00248  */
00249 const char *vaQueryVendorString (
00250     VADisplay dpy

00379 /*
00380  * Configuration attributes
00381  * If there is more than one value for an attribute, a default
00382  * value will be assigned to the attribute if the client does not
00383  * specify the attribute when creating a configuration
00384  */
00385 typedef struct _VAConfigAttrib {
00386     VAConfigAttribType type;
00387     unsigned int value; /* OR'd flags (bits) for this attribute */
00388 } VAConfigAttrib;
00389

00393 #define VA_RT_FORMAT_YUV444     0x00000004
00394 #define VA_RT_FORMAT_PROTECTED  0x80000000

00456 /* Get maximum number of profiles supported by the implementation */
00457 int vaMaxNumProfiles (
00458     VADisplay dpy
00459 );
00460 
00461 /* Get maximum number of entrypoints supported by the implementation */
00462 int vaMaxNumEntrypoints (
00463     VADisplay dpy
00464 );
00465 
00466 /* Get maximum number of attributs supported by the implementation */
00467 int vaMaxNumConfigAttributes (
00468     VADisplay dpy
00469 );

00471 /* 
00472  * Query supported profiles 
00473  * The caller must provide a "profile_list" array that can hold at
00474  * least vaMaxNumProfile() entries. The actual number of profiles
00475  * returned in "profile_list" is returned in "num_profile".
00476  */
00477 VAStatus vaQueryConfigProfiles (
00478     VADisplay dpy,
00479     VAProfile *profile_list,    /* out */
00480     int *num_profiles           /* out */
00481 );
00482 
00483 /* 
00484  * Query supported entrypoints for a given profile 
00485  * The caller must provide an "entrypoint_list" array that can hold at
00486  * least vaMaxNumEntrypoints() entries. The actual number of entrypoints 
00487  * returned in "entrypoint_list" is returned in "num_entrypoints".
00488  */
00489 VAStatus vaQueryConfigEntrypoints (
00490     VADisplay dpy,
00491     VAProfile profile,
00492     VAEntrypoint *entrypoint_list,      /* out */
00493     int *num_entrypoints                /* out */
00494 );
00495 
00496 /* 
00497  * Get attributes for a given profile/entrypoint pair 
00498  * The caller must provide an "attrib_list" with all attributes to be 
00499  * retrieved.  Upon return, the attributes in "attrib_list" have been 
00500  * updated with their value.  Unknown attributes or attributes that are 
00501  * not supported for the given profile/entrypoint pair will have their 
00502  * value set to VA_ATTRIB_NOT_SUPPORTED
00503  */
00504 VAStatus vaGetConfigAttributes (
00505     VADisplay dpy,
00506     VAProfile profile,
00507     VAEntrypoint entrypoint,
00508     VAConfigAttrib *attrib_list, /* in/out */
00509     int num_attribs
00510 );
00511 
00512 /* Generic ID type, can be re-typed for specific implementation */
00513 typedef unsigned int VAGenericID;
00514 
00515 typedef VAGenericID VAConfigID;
00516 
00517 /* 
00518  * Create a configuration for the decode pipeline 
00519  * it passes in the attribute list that specifies the attributes it cares 
00520  * about, with the rest taking default values.  
00521  */
00522 VAStatus vaCreateConfig (
00523     VADisplay dpy,
00524     VAProfile profile, 
00525     VAEntrypoint entrypoint, 
00526     VAConfigAttrib *attrib_list,
00527     int num_attribs,
00528     VAConfigID *config_id /* out */
00529 );
00530 
00531 /* 
00532  * Free resources associdated with a given config 
00533  */
00534 VAStatus vaDestroyConfig (
00535     VADisplay dpy,
00536     VAConfigID config_id
00537 );
00538 
00539 /* 
00540  * Query all attributes for a given configuration 
00541  * The profile of the configuration is returned in "profile"
00542  * The entrypoint of the configuration is returned in "entrypoint"
00543  * The caller must provide an "attrib_list" array that can hold at least 
00544  * vaMaxNumConfigAttributes() entries. The actual number of attributes 
00545  * returned in "attrib_list" is returned in "num_attribs"
00546  */
00547 VAStatus vaQueryConfigAttributes (
00548     VADisplay dpy,
00549     VAConfigID config_id, 
00550     VAProfile *profile,         /* out */
00551     VAEntrypoint *entrypoint,   /* out */
00552     VAConfigAttrib *attrib_list,/* out */
00553     int *num_attribs            /* out */
00554 );
00555 
00556 
00557 /*
00558  * Contexts and Surfaces
00559  *
00560  * Context represents a "virtual" video decode pipeline. Surfaces are render 
00561  * targets for a given context. The data in the surfaces are not accessible  
00562  * to the client and the internal data format of the surface is implementatin 
00563  * specific. 
00564  *
00565  * Surfaces will be bound to a context when the context is created. Once
00566  * a surface is bound to a given context, it can not be used to create  
00567  * another context. The association is removed when the context is destroyed
00568  * 
00569  * Both contexts and surfaces are identified by unique IDs and its
00570  * implementation specific internals are kept opaque to the clients
00571  */
00572 
00573 typedef VAGenericID VAContextID;
00574 
00575 typedef VAGenericID VASurfaceID;
00576 
00577 #define VA_INVALID_ID           0xffffffff
00578 #define VA_INVALID_SURFACE      VA_INVALID_ID
00579 
00581 typedef enum  {
00582     VAGenericValueTypeInteger = 1,      
00583     VAGenericValueTypeFloat,            
00584     VAGenericValueTypePointer,          
00585     VAGenericValueTypeFunc              
00586 } VAGenericValueType;
00587 
00589 typedef void (*VAGenericFunc)(void);
00590 
00592 typedef struct _VAGenericValue {
00594     VAGenericValueType  type;
00596     union {
00598         int             i;
00600         float           f;
00602         void           *p;
00604         VAGenericFunc   fn;
00605     }                   value;
00606 } VAGenericValue;
00607 
00608 /* 
00609  * vaCreateSurfaces - Create an array of surfaces used for decode and display  
00610  *  dpy: display
00611  *  width: surface width
00612  *  height: surface height
00613  *  format: VA_RT_FORMAT_YUV420, VA_RT_FORMAT_YUV422 or VA_RT_FORMAT_YUV444
00614  *  num_surfaces: number of surfaces to be created
00615  *  surfaces: array of surfaces created upon return
00616  */
00617 VAStatus vaCreateSurfaces (
00618     VADisplay dpy,
00619     int width,
00620     int height,
00621     int format,
00622     int num_surfaces,
00623     VASurfaceID *surfaces       /* out */
00624 );
00625 
00626     
00627 /*
00628  * vaDestroySurfaces - Destroy resources associated with surfaces. 
00629  *  Surfaces can only be destroyed after the context associated has been 
00630  *  destroyed.  
00631  *  dpy: display
00632  *  surfaces: array of surfaces to destroy
00633  *  num_surfaces: number of surfaces in the array to be destroyed.
00634  */
00635 VAStatus vaDestroySurfaces (
00636     VADisplay dpy,
00637     VASurfaceID *surfaces,
00638     int num_surfaces
00639 );
00640 
00641 #define VA_PROGRESSIVE 0x1
00642 /*
00643  * vaCreateContext - Create a context
00644  *  dpy: display
00645  *  config_id: configuration for the context
00646  *  picture_width: coded picture width
00647  *  picture_height: coded picture height
00648  *  flag: any combination of the following:
00649  *    VA_PROGRESSIVE (only progressive frame pictures in the sequence when set)
00650  *  render_targets: render targets (surfaces) tied to the context
00651  *  num_render_targets: number of render targets in the above array
00652  *  context: created context id upon return
00653  */
00654 VAStatus vaCreateContext (
00655     VADisplay dpy,
00656     VAConfigID config_id,
00657     int picture_width,
00658     int picture_height,
00659     int flag,
00660     VASurfaceID *render_targets,
00661     int num_render_targets,
00662     VAContextID *context                /* out */
00663 );
00664 
00665 /*
00666  * vaDestroyContext - Destroy a context 
00667  *  dpy: display
00668  *  context: context to be destroyed
00669  */
00670 VAStatus vaDestroyContext (
00671     VADisplay dpy,
00672     VAContextID context
00673 );
00674 
00675 /*
00676  * Buffers 
00677  * Buffers are used to pass various types of data from the
00678  * client to the server. The server maintains a data store
00679  * for each buffer created, and the client idenfies a buffer
00680  * through a unique buffer id assigned by the server.
00681  */
00682 
00683 typedef VAGenericID VABufferID;
00684 
00685 typedef enum
00686 {
00687     VAPictureParameterBufferType        = 0,
00688     VAIQMatrixBufferType                = 1,
00689     VABitPlaneBufferType                = 2,
00690     VASliceGroupMapBufferType           = 3,
00691     VASliceParameterBufferType          = 4,
00692     VASliceDataBufferType               = 5,
00693     VAMacroblockParameterBufferType     = 6,
00694     VAResidualDataBufferType            = 7,
00695     VADeblockingParameterBufferType     = 8,
00696     VAImageBufferType                   = 9,
00697     VAProtectedSliceDataBufferType      = 10,
00698     VAQMatrixBufferType                 = 11,
00699 /* Following are encode buffer types */
00700     VAEncCodedBufferType                = 21,
00701     VAEncSequenceParameterBufferType    = 22,
00702     VAEncPictureParameterBufferType     = 23,
00703     VAEncSliceParameterBufferType       = 24,
00704     VAEncPackedHeaderParameterBufferType = 25,
00705     VAEncPackedHeaderDataBufferType     = 26,
00706     VAEncMiscParameterBufferType        = 27,
00707     VAEncMacroblockParameterBufferType  = 28,
00708     VABufferTypeMax                     = 0xff
00709 } VABufferType;
00710 
00711 typedef enum

00718     VAEncMiscParameterTypeMaxFrameSize  = 4,

00743 /*
00744  *  For application, e.g. set a new bitrate
00745  *    VABufferID buf_id;
00746  *    VAEncMiscParameterBuffer *misc_param;
00747  *    VAEncMiscParameterRateControl *misc_rate_ctrl;
00748  * 
00749  *    vaCreateBuffer(dpy, context, VAEncMiscParameterBufferType,
00750  *              sizeof(VAEncMiscParameterBuffer) + sizeof(VAEncMiscParameterRateControl),
00751  *              1, NULL, &buf_id);
00752  *
00753  *    vaMapBuffer(dpy,buf_id,(void **)&misc_param);
00754  *    misc_param->type = VAEncMiscParameterTypeRateControl;
00755  *    misc_rate_ctrl= (VAEncMiscParameterRateControl *)misc_param->data;
00756  *    misc_rate_ctrl->bits_per_second = 6400000;
00757  *    vaUnmapBuffer(dpy, buf_id);
00758  *    vaRenderPicture(dpy, context, &buf_id, 1);
00759  */
00760 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterBuffer
00761 {
00762     VAEncMiscParameterType type;
00763     unsigned int data[0];
00764 } VAEncMiscParameterBuffer;
00765 
00766 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterRateControl
00767 {
00768     unsigned int bits_per_second; /* this is the maximum bit-rate to be constrained by the rate control implementation */
00769     unsigned int target_percentage; /* this is the bit-rate the rate control is targeting, as a percentage of the maximum bit-rate */
00770                                     /* for example if target_percentage is 95 then the rate control will target a bit-rate that is */
00771                                     /* 95% of the maximum bit-rate */
00772     unsigned int window_size; /* windows size in milliseconds. For example if this is set to 500, then the rate control will guarantee the */
00773                               /* target bit-rate over a 500 ms window */
00774     unsigned int initial_qp;  /* initial QP at I frames */
00775     unsigned int min_qp;     
00776 } VAEncMiscParameterRateControl;
00777 
00778 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterFrameRate
00779 {
00780     unsigned int framerate;
00781 } VAEncMiscParameterFrameRate;
00782 
00783 /*
00784  * Allow a maximum slice size to be specified (in bits).
00785  * The encoder will attempt to make sure that individual slices do not exceed this size
00786  * Or to signal applicate if the slice size exceed this size, see "status" of VACodedBufferSegment
00787  */
00788 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterMaxSliceSize
00789 {
00790     unsigned int max_slice_size;
00791 } VAEncMiscParameterMaxSliceSize;
00792 
00793 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterAIR
00794 {

00796     unsigned int air_threshold;
00797     unsigned int air_auto; /* if set to 1 then hardware auto-tune the AIR threshold */
00798 } VAEncMiscParameterAIR;

00809 typedef struct _VAEncMiscParameterBufferMaxFrameSize {
00811     VAEncMiscParameterType      type;
00813     unsigned int                max_frame_size;
00814 } VAEncMiscParameterBufferMaxFrameSize;
00815 
00816 /* 
00817  * There will be cases where the bitstream buffer will not have enough room to hold
00818  * the data for the entire slice, and the following flags will be used in the slice
00819  * parameter to signal to the server for the possible cases.
00820  * If a slice parameter buffer and slice data buffer pair is sent to the server with 
00821  * the slice data partially in the slice data buffer (BEGIN and MIDDLE cases below), 
00822  * then a slice parameter and data buffer needs to be sent again to complete this slice. 
00823  */
00824 #define VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_ALL          0x00    /* whole slice is in the buffer */
00825 #define VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_BEGIN        0x01    /* The beginning of the slice is in the buffer but the end if not */
00826 #define VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_MIDDLE       0x02    /* Neither beginning nor end of the slice is in the buffer */
00827 #define VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_END          0x04    /* end of the slice is in the buffer */
00828 
00829 /* Codec-independent Slice Parameter Buffer base */
00830 typedef struct _VASliceParameterBufferBase
00831 {
00832     unsigned int slice_data_size;       /* number of bytes in the slice data buffer for this slice */
00833     unsigned int slice_data_offset;     /* the offset to the first byte of slice data */
00834     unsigned int slice_data_flag;       /* see VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_XXX definitions */
00835 } VASliceParameterBufferBase;

00884             unsigned int intra_vlc_format               : 1;

00887             unsigned int progressive_frame              : 1;

00889                                                               * is the first field for field picture

00922 /* MPEG-2 Macroblock Parameter Buffer */
00923 typedef struct _VAMacroblockParameterBufferMPEG2
00924 {
00925     unsigned short macroblock_address;
00926     /* 
00927      * macroblock_address (in raster scan order)
00928      * top-left: 0
00929      * bottom-right: picture-height-in-mb*picture-width-in-mb - 1
00930      */
00931     unsigned char macroblock_type;  /* see definition below */
00932     union {
00933         struct {
00934             unsigned int frame_motion_type              : 2; 
00935             unsigned int field_motion_type              : 2; 
00936             unsigned int dct_type                       : 1; 
00937         } bits;
00938         unsigned int value;
00939     } macroblock_modes;
00940     unsigned char motion_vertical_field_select; 
00941     /* 
00942      * motion_vertical_field_select:
00943      * see section 6.3.17.2 in the spec
00944      * only the lower 4 bits are used
00945      * bit 0: first vector forward
00946      * bit 1: first vector backward
00947      * bit 2: second vector forward
00948      * bit 3: second vector backward
00949      */
00950     short PMV[2][2][2]; /* see Table 7-7 in the spec */
00951     unsigned short coded_block_pattern;
00952     /* 
00953      * The bitplanes for coded_block_pattern are described 
00954      * in Figure 6.10-12 in the spec
00955      */
00956      
00957     /* Number of skipped macroblocks after this macroblock */
00958     unsigned short num_skipped_macroblocks;
00959 } VAMacroblockParameterBufferMPEG2;
00960 
00961 /* 
00962  * OR'd flags for macroblock_type (section 6.3.17.1 in the spec)
00963  */
00964 #define VA_MB_TYPE_MOTION_FORWARD       0x02
00965 #define VA_MB_TYPE_MOTION_BACKWARD      0x04
00966 #define VA_MB_TYPE_MOTION_PATTERN       0x08
00967 #define VA_MB_TYPE_MOTION_INTRA         0x10
00968

00970  * MPEG-2 Residual Data Buffer 
00971  * For each macroblock, there wil be 64 shorts (16-bit) in the 
00972  * residual data buffer
00973  */
00974

01065 /* VC-1 Picture Parameter Buffer */
01066 /* 
01067  * For each picture, and before any slice data, a picture parameter
01068  * buffer must be send. Multiple picture parameter buffers may be
01069  * sent for a single picture. In that case picture parameters will
01070  * apply to all slice data that follow it until a new picture
01071  * parameter buffer is sent.
01072  *
01073  * Notes:
01074  *   pic_quantizer_type should be set to the applicable quantizer
01075  *   type as defined by QUANTIZER (J.1.19) and either
01076  *   PQUANTIZER (7.1.1.8) or PQINDEX (7.1.1.6)
01077  */
01078 typedef struct _VAPictureParameterBufferVC1
01079 {
01080     VASurfaceID forward_reference_picture;
01081     VASurfaceID backward_reference_picture;
01082     /* if out-of-loop post-processing is done on the render
01083        target, then we need to keep the in-loop decoded 
01084        picture as a reference picture */
01085     VASurfaceID inloop_decoded_picture;
01086 
01087     /* sequence layer for AP or meta data for SP and MP */
01088     union {
01089         struct {
01090             unsigned int pulldown       : 1; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::PULLDOWN */
01091             unsigned int interlace      : 1; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::INTERLACE */
01092             unsigned int tfcntrflag     : 1; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::TFCNTRFLAG */
01093             unsigned int finterpflag    : 1; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::FINTERPFLAG */
01094             unsigned int psf            : 1; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::PSF */
01095             unsigned int multires       : 1; /* METADATA::MULTIRES */
01096             unsigned int overlap        : 1; /* METADATA::OVERLAP */
01097             unsigned int syncmarker     : 1; /* METADATA::SYNCMARKER */
01098             unsigned int rangered       : 1; /* METADATA::RANGERED */
01099             unsigned int max_b_frames   : 3; /* METADATA::MAXBFRAMES */
01100             unsigned int profile        : 2; /* SEQUENCE_LAYER::PROFILE or The MSB of METADATA::PROFILE */
01101         } bits;
01102         unsigned int value;
01103     } sequence_fields;
01104 
01105     unsigned short coded_width;         /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::CODED_WIDTH */
01106     unsigned short coded_height;        /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::CODED_HEIGHT */
01107     union {
01108         struct {
01109             unsigned int broken_link    : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::BROKEN_LINK */
01110             unsigned int closed_entry   : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::CLOSED_ENTRY */
01111             unsigned int panscan_flag   : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::PANSCAN_FLAG */
01112             unsigned int loopfilter     : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::LOOPFILTER */
01113         } bits;
01114         unsigned int value;
01115     } entrypoint_fields;
01116     unsigned char conditional_overlap_flag; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::CONDOVER */
01117     unsigned char fast_uvmc_flag;       /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::FASTUVMC */
01118     union {
01119         struct {
01120             unsigned int luma_flag      : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::RANGE_MAPY_FLAG */
01121             unsigned int luma           : 3; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::RANGE_MAPY */
01122             unsigned int chroma_flag    : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::RANGE_MAPUV_FLAG */
01123             unsigned int chroma         : 3; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::RANGE_MAPUV */
01124         } bits;
01125         unsigned int value;
01126     } range_mapping_fields;
01127 
01128     unsigned char b_picture_fraction;   /* PICTURE_LAYER::BFRACTION */
01129     unsigned char cbp_table;            /* PICTURE_LAYER::CBPTAB/ICBPTAB */
01130     unsigned char mb_mode_table;        /* PICTURE_LAYER::MBMODETAB */
01131     unsigned char range_reduction_frame;/* PICTURE_LAYER::RANGEREDFRM */
01132     unsigned char rounding_control;     /* PICTURE_LAYER::RNDCTRL */
01133     unsigned char post_processing;      /* PICTURE_LAYER::POSTPROC */
01134     unsigned char picture_resolution_index;     /* PICTURE_LAYER::RESPIC */
01135     unsigned char luma_scale;           /* PICTURE_LAYER::LUMSCALE */
01136     unsigned char luma_shift;           /* PICTURE_LAYER::LUMSHIFT */
01137     union {
01138         struct {
01139             unsigned int picture_type           : 3; /* PICTURE_LAYER::PTYPE */
01140             unsigned int frame_coding_mode      : 3; /* PICTURE_LAYER::FCM */
01141             unsigned int top_field_first        : 1; /* PICTURE_LAYER::TFF */
01142             unsigned int is_first_field         : 1; /* set to 1 if it is the first field */
01143             unsigned int intensity_compensation : 1; /* PICTURE_LAYER::INTCOMP */
01144         } bits;
01145         unsigned int value;
01146     } picture_fields;
01147     union {
01148         struct {
01149             unsigned int mv_type_mb     : 1;    /* PICTURE::MVTYPEMB */
01150             unsigned int direct_mb      : 1;    /* PICTURE::DIRECTMB */
01151             unsigned int skip_mb        : 1;    /* PICTURE::SKIPMB */
01152             unsigned int field_tx       : 1;    /* PICTURE::FIELDTX */
01153             unsigned int forward_mb     : 1;    /* PICTURE::FORWARDMB */
01154             unsigned int ac_pred        : 1;    /* PICTURE::ACPRED */
01155             unsigned int overflags      : 1;    /* PICTURE::OVERFLAGS */
01156         } flags;
01157         unsigned int value;
01158     } raw_coding;
01159     union {
01160         struct {
01161             unsigned int bp_mv_type_mb   : 1;    /* PICTURE::MVTYPEMB */
01162             unsigned int bp_direct_mb    : 1;    /* PICTURE::DIRECTMB */
01163             unsigned int bp_skip_mb      : 1;    /* PICTURE::SKIPMB */  
01164             unsigned int bp_field_tx     : 1;    /* PICTURE::FIELDTX */ 
01165             unsigned int bp_forward_mb   : 1;    /* PICTURE::FORWARDMB */
01166             unsigned int bp_ac_pred      : 1;    /* PICTURE::ACPRED */   
01167             unsigned int bp_overflags    : 1;    /* PICTURE::OVERFLAGS */
01168         } flags;
01169         unsigned int value;
01170     } bitplane_present; /* signal what bitplane is being passed via the bitplane buffer */
01171     union {
01172         struct {
01173             unsigned int reference_distance_flag : 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::REFDIST_FLAG */
01174             unsigned int reference_distance     : 5;/* PICTURE_LAYER::REFDIST */
01175             unsigned int num_reference_pictures: 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::NUMREF */
01176             unsigned int reference_field_pic_indicator  : 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::REFFIELD */
01177         } bits;
01178         unsigned int value;
01179     } reference_fields;
01180     union {
01181         struct {
01182             unsigned int mv_mode                : 3; /* PICTURE_LAYER::MVMODE */
01183             unsigned int mv_mode2               : 3; /* PICTURE_LAYER::MVMODE2 */
01184             unsigned int mv_table               : 3; /* PICTURE_LAYER::MVTAB/IMVTAB */
01185             unsigned int two_mv_block_pattern_table: 2; /* PICTURE_LAYER::2MVBPTAB */
01186             unsigned int four_mv_switch         : 1; /* PICTURE_LAYER::4MVSWITCH */
01187             unsigned int four_mv_block_pattern_table : 2; /* PICTURE_LAYER::4MVBPTAB */
01188             unsigned int extended_mv_flag       : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::EXTENDED_MV */
01189             unsigned int extended_mv_range      : 2; /* PICTURE_LAYER::MVRANGE */
01190             unsigned int extended_dmv_flag      : 1; /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::EXTENDED_DMV */
01191             unsigned int extended_dmv_range     : 2; /* PICTURE_LAYER::DMVRANGE */
01192         } bits;
01193         unsigned int value;
01194     } mv_fields;
01195     union {
01196         struct {
01197             unsigned int dquant : 2;    /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::DQUANT */
01198             unsigned int quantizer     : 2;     /* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::QUANTIZER */
01199             unsigned int half_qp        : 1;    /* PICTURE_LAYER::HALFQP */
01200             unsigned int pic_quantizer_scale : 5;/* PICTURE_LAYER::PQUANT */
01201             unsigned int pic_quantizer_type : 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::PQUANTIZER */
01202             unsigned int dq_frame       : 1;    /* VOPDQUANT::DQUANTFRM */
01203             unsigned int dq_profile     : 2;    /* VOPDQUANT::DQPROFILE */
01204             unsigned int dq_sb_edge     : 2;    /* VOPDQUANT::DQSBEDGE */
01205             unsigned int dq_db_edge     : 2;    /* VOPDQUANT::DQDBEDGE */
01206             unsigned int dq_binary_level : 1;   /* VOPDQUANT::DQBILEVEL */
01207             unsigned int alt_pic_quantizer : 5;/* VOPDQUANT::ALTPQUANT */
01208         } bits;
01209         unsigned int value;
01210     } pic_quantizer_fields;
01211     union {
01212         struct {
01213             unsigned int variable_sized_transform_flag  : 1;/* ENTRY_POINT_LAYER::VSTRANSFORM */
01214             unsigned int mb_level_transform_type_flag   : 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::TTMBF */
01215             unsigned int frame_level_transform_type     : 2;/* PICTURE_LAYER::TTFRM */
01216             unsigned int transform_ac_codingset_idx1    : 2;/* PICTURE_LAYER::TRANSACFRM */
01217             unsigned int transform_ac_codingset_idx2    : 2;/* PICTURE_LAYER::TRANSACFRM2 */
01218             unsigned int intra_transform_dc_table       : 1;/* PICTURE_LAYER::TRANSDCTAB */
01219         } bits;
01220         unsigned int value;
01221     } transform_fields;
01222 } VAPictureParameterBufferVC1;
01223 
01224 /* VC-1 Bitplane Buffer 
01225 There will be at most three bitplanes coded in any picture header. To send 
01226 the bitplane data more efficiently, each byte is divided in two nibbles, with
01227 each nibble carrying three bitplanes for one macroblock.  The following table
01228 shows the bitplane data arrangement within each nibble based on the picture
01229 type.
01230 
01231 Picture Type    Bit3            Bit2            Bit1            Bit0
01232 I or BI                         OVERFLAGS       ACPRED          FIELDTX
01233 P                               MYTYPEMB        SKIPMB          DIRECTMB
01234 B                               FORWARDMB       SKIPMB          DIRECTMB
01235 
01236 Within each byte, the lower nibble is for the first MB and the upper nibble is 
01237 for the second MB.  E.g. the lower nibble of the first byte in the bitplane
01238 buffer is for Macroblock #1 and the upper nibble of the first byte is for 
01239 Macroblock #2 in the first row.
01240 */
01241 
01242 /* VC-1 Slice Parameter Buffer */
01243 typedef struct _VASliceParameterBufferVC1
01244 {
01245     unsigned int slice_data_size;/* number of bytes in the slice data buffer for this slice */
01246     unsigned int slice_data_offset;/* the offset to the first byte of slice data */
01247     unsigned int slice_data_flag; /* see VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_XXX defintions */
01248     unsigned int macroblock_offset;/* the offset to the first bit of MB from the first byte of slice data */
01249     unsigned int slice_vertical_position;
01250 } VASliceParameterBufferVC1;
01251 
01252 /* VC-1 Slice Data Buffer */
01253 /* 
01254 This is simplely a buffer containing raw bit-stream bytes 
01255 */
01256 
01257 /****************************
01258  * H.264/AVC data structures
01259  ****************************/
01260 
01261 typedef struct _VAPictureH264
01262 {
01263     VASurfaceID picture_id;
01264     unsigned int frame_idx;
01265     unsigned int flags;
01266     signed int TopFieldOrderCnt;
01267     signed int BottomFieldOrderCnt;
01268 } VAPictureH264;
01269 /* flags in VAPictureH264 could be OR of the following */
01270 #define VA_PICTURE_H264_INVALID                 0x00000001
01271 #define VA_PICTURE_H264_TOP_FIELD               0x00000002
01272 #define VA_PICTURE_H264_BOTTOM_FIELD            0x00000004
01273 #define VA_PICTURE_H264_SHORT_TERM_REFERENCE    0x00000008
01274 #define VA_PICTURE_H264_LONG_TERM_REFERENCE     0x00000010
01275 
01276 /* H.264 Picture Parameter Buffer */
01277 /* 
01278  * For each picture, and before any slice data, a single
01279  * picture parameter buffer must be send.
01280  */
01281 typedef struct _VAPictureParameterBufferH264
01282 {
01283     VAPictureH264 CurrPic;
01284     VAPictureH264 ReferenceFrames[16];  /* in DPB */
01285     unsigned short picture_width_in_mbs_minus1;
01286     unsigned short picture_height_in_mbs_minus1;
01287     unsigned char bit_depth_luma_minus8;
01288     unsigned char bit_depth_chroma_minus8;
01289     unsigned char num_ref_frames;
01290     union {
01291         struct {
01292             unsigned int chroma_format_idc                      : 2; 
01293             unsigned int residual_colour_transform_flag         : 1; 
01294             unsigned int gaps_in_frame_num_value_allowed_flag   : 1; 
01295             unsigned int frame_mbs_only_flag                    : 1; 
01296             unsigned int mb_adaptive_frame_field_flag           : 1; 
01297             unsigned int direct_8x8_inference_flag              : 1; 
01298             unsigned int MinLumaBiPredSize8x8                   : 1; /* see A.3.3.2 */
01299             unsigned int log2_max_frame_num_minus4              : 4;
01300             unsigned int pic_order_cnt_type                     : 2;
01301             unsigned int log2_max_pic_order_cnt_lsb_minus4      : 4;
01302             unsigned int delta_pic_order_always_zero_flag       : 1;
01303         } bits;
01304         unsigned int value;
01305     } seq_fields;
01306     unsigned char num_slice_groups_minus1;
01307     unsigned char slice_group_map_type;
01308     unsigned short slice_group_change_rate_minus1;
01309     signed char pic_init_qp_minus26;
01310     signed char pic_init_qs_minus26;
01311     signed char chroma_qp_index_offset;
01312     signed char second_chroma_qp_index_offset;
01313     union {
01314         struct {
01315             unsigned int entropy_coding_mode_flag       : 1;
01316             unsigned int weighted_pred_flag             : 1;
01317             unsigned int weighted_bipred_idc            : 2;
01318             unsigned int transform_8x8_mode_flag        : 1;
01319             unsigned int field_pic_flag                 : 1;
01320             unsigned int constrained_intra_pred_flag    : 1;
01321             unsigned int pic_order_present_flag                 : 1;
01322             unsigned int deblocking_filter_control_present_flag : 1;
01323             unsigned int redundant_pic_cnt_present_flag         : 1;
01324             unsigned int reference_pic_flag                     : 1; /* nal_ref_idc != 0 */
01325         } bits;
01326         unsigned int value;
01327     } pic_fields;
01328     unsigned short frame_num;
01329 } VAPictureParameterBufferH264;
01330 
01331 /* H.264 Inverse Quantization Matrix Buffer */
01332 typedef struct _VAIQMatrixBufferH264
01333 {
01334     unsigned char ScalingList4x4[6][16];
01335     unsigned char ScalingList8x8[2][64];
01336 } VAIQMatrixBufferH264;
01337 
01338 /* 
01339  * H.264 Slice Group Map Buffer 
01340  * When VAPictureParameterBufferH264::num_slice_group_minus1 is not equal to 0,
01341  * A slice group map buffer should be sent for each picture if required. The buffer
01342  * is sent only when there is a change in the mapping values.
01343  * The slice group map buffer map "map units" to slice groups as specified in 
01344  * section 8.2.2 of the H.264 spec. The buffer will contain one byte for each macroblock 
01345  * in raster scan order
01346  */ 
01347 
01348 /* H.264 Slice Parameter Buffer */
01349 typedef struct _VASliceParameterBufferH264
01350 {
01351     unsigned int slice_data_size;/* number of bytes in the slice data buffer for this slice */
01352     unsigned int slice_data_offset;/* the offset to the NAL start code for this slice */
01353     unsigned int slice_data_flag; /* see VA_SLICE_DATA_FLAG_XXX defintions */
01354     unsigned short slice_data_bit_offset; /* bit offset from NAL start code to the beginning of slice data */
01355     unsigned short first_mb_in_slice;
01356     unsigned char slice_type;
01357     unsigned char direct_spatial_mv_pred_flag;
01358     unsigned char num_ref_idx_l0_active_minus1;
01359     unsigned char num_ref_idx_l1_active_minus1;
01360     unsigned char cabac_init_idc;
01361     char slice_qp_delta;
01362     unsigned char disable_deblocking_filter_idc;
01363     char slice_alpha_c0_offset_div2;
01364     char slice_beta_offset_div2;
01365     VAPictureH264 RefPicList0[32];      /* See 8.2.4.2 */
01366     VAPictureH264 RefPicList1[32];      /* See 8.2.4.2 */
01367     unsigned char luma_log2_weight_denom;
01368     unsigned char chroma_log2_weight_denom;
01369     unsigned char luma_weight_l0_flag;
01370     short luma_weight_l0[32];
01371     short luma_offset_l0[32];
01372     unsigned char chroma_weight_l0_flag;
01373     short chroma_weight_l0[32][2];
01374     short chroma_offset_l0[32][2];
01375     unsigned char luma_weight_l1_flag;
01376     short luma_weight_l1[32];
01377     short luma_offset_l1[32];
01378     unsigned char chroma_weight_l1_flag;
01379     short chroma_weight_l1[32][2];
01380     short chroma_offset_l1[32][2];
01381 } VASliceParameterBufferH264;

01496 
01497 
01498 /* Buffer functions */
01499 
01500 /*
01501  * Creates a buffer for "num_elements" elements of "size" bytes and 
01502  * initalize with "data".
01503  * if "data" is null, then the contents of the buffer data store
01504  * are undefined.
01505  * Basically there are two ways to get buffer data to the server side. One is 
01506  * to call vaCreateBuffer() with a non-null "data", which results the data being
01507  * copied to the data store on the server side.  A different method that 
01508  * eliminates this copy is to pass null as "data" when calling vaCreateBuffer(),
01509  * and then use vaMapBuffer() to map the data store from the server side to the
01510  * client address space for access.
01511  *  Note: image buffers are created by the library, not the client. Please see 
01512  *        vaCreateImage on how image buffers are managed.
01513  */
01514 VAStatus vaCreateBuffer (
01515     VADisplay dpy,
01516     VAContextID context,
01517     VABufferType type,  /* in */
01518     unsigned int size,  /* in */
01519     unsigned int num_elements, /* in */
01520     void *data,         /* in */
01521     VABufferID *buf_id  /* out */
01522 );
01523 
01524 /*
01525  * Convey to the server how many valid elements are in the buffer. 
01526  * e.g. if multiple slice parameters are being held in a single buffer,
01527  * this will communicate to the server the number of slice parameters
01528  * that are valid in the buffer.
01529  */
01530 VAStatus vaBufferSetNumElements (
01531     VADisplay dpy,
01532     VABufferID buf_id,  /* in */
01533     unsigned int num_elements /* in */
01534 );
01535 
01536 
01537 /*
01538  * device independent data structure for codedbuffer
01539  */
01540 
01541 /* 
01542  * FICTURE_AVE_QP(bit7-0): The average Qp value used during this frame
01543  * LARGE_SLICE(bit8):At least one slice in the current frame was large
01544  *              enough for the encoder to attempt to limit its size.
01545  * SLICE_OVERFLOW(bit9): At least one slice in the current frame has
01546  *              exceeded the maximum slice size specified.
01547  * BITRATE_OVERFLOW(bit10): The peak bitrate was exceeded for this frame.
01548  * BITRATE_HIGH(bit11): The frame size got within the safety margin of the maximum size (VCM only)
01549  * AIR_MB_OVER_THRESHOLD: the number of MBs adapted to Intra MB
01550  */
01551 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_PICTURE_AVE_QP_MASK         0xff
01552 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_LARGE_SLICE_MASK            0x100
01553 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_SLICE_OVERFLOW_MASK         0x200
01554 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_BITRATE_OVERFLOW            0x400
01555 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_BITRATE_HIGH                0x800
01556 
01563 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_FRAME_SIZE_OVERFLOW         0x1000
01564 #define VA_CODED_BUF_STATUS_AIR_MB_OVER_THRESHOLD       0xff0000
01565 
01574 typedef  struct _VACodedBufferSegment  {
01581     unsigned int        size;
01583     unsigned int        bit_offset;
01585     unsigned int        status;
01587     unsigned int        reserved;
01589     void               *buf;
01594     void               *next;
01595 } VACodedBufferSegment;
01596      
01597 /*
01598  * Map data store of the buffer into the client's address space
01599  * vaCreateBuffer() needs to be called with "data" set to NULL before
01600  * calling vaMapBuffer()
01601  *
01602  * if buffer type is VAEncCodedBufferType, pbuf points to link-list of
01603  * VACodedBufferSegment, and the list is terminated if "next" is NULL
01604  */
01605 VAStatus vaMapBuffer (
01606     VADisplay dpy,
01607     VABufferID buf_id,  /* in */
01608     void **pbuf         /* out */
01609 );
01610 
01611 /*
01612  * After client making changes to a mapped data store, it needs to
01613  * "Unmap" it to let the server know that the data is ready to be
01614  * consumed by the server
01615  */
01616 VAStatus vaUnmapBuffer (
01617     VADisplay dpy,
01618     VABufferID buf_id   /* in */
01619 );
01620 
01621 /*
01622  * After this call, the buffer is deleted and this buffer_id is no longer valid
01623  * Only call this if the buffer is not going to be passed to vaRenderBuffer
01624  */
01625 VAStatus vaDestroyBuffer (
01626     VADisplay dpy,
01627     VABufferID buffer_id
01628 );
01629 
01630 /*
01631 Render (Decode) Pictures
01632 
01633 A picture represents either a frame or a field.
01634 
01635 The Begin/Render/End sequence sends the decode buffers to the server
01636 */
01637 
01638 /*
01639  * Get ready to decode a picture to a target surface
01640  */
01641 VAStatus vaBeginPicture (
01642     VADisplay dpy,
01643     VAContextID context,
01644     VASurfaceID render_target
01645 );
01646 
01647 /* 
01648  * Send decode buffers to the server.
01649  * Buffers are automatically destroyed afterwards
01650  */
01651 VAStatus vaRenderPicture (
01652     VADisplay dpy,
01653     VAContextID context,
01654     VABufferID *buffers,
01655     int num_buffers
01656 );
01657 
01658 /* 
01659  * Make the end of rendering for a picture. 
01660  * The server should start processing all pending operations for this 
01661  * surface. This call is non-blocking. The client can start another 
01662  * Begin/Render/End sequence on a different render target.
01663  */
01664 VAStatus vaEndPicture (
01665     VADisplay dpy,
01666     VAContextID context
01667 );
01668 
01669 /*
01670 
01671 Synchronization 
01672 
01673 */
01674 
01675 /* 
01676  * This function blocks until all pending operations on the render target
01677  * have been completed.  Upon return it is safe to use the render target for a 
01678  * different picture. 
01679  */
01680 VAStatus vaSyncSurface (
01681     VADisplay dpy,
01682     VASurfaceID render_target
01683 );
01684 
01685 typedef enum
01686 {
01687     VASurfaceRendering  = 1, /* Rendering in progress */ 
01688     VASurfaceDisplaying = 2, /* Displaying in progress (not safe to render into it) */ 
01689                              /* this status is useful if surface is used as the source */
01690                              /* of an overlay */
01691     VASurfaceReady      = 4, /* not being rendered or displayed */
01692     VASurfaceSkipped    = 8  /* Indicate a skipped frame during encode */
01693 } VASurfaceStatus;
01694 
01695 /*
01696  * Find out any pending ops on the render target 
01697  */
01698 VAStatus vaQuerySurfaceStatus (
01699     VADisplay dpy,
01700     VASurfaceID render_target,
01701     VASurfaceStatus *status     /* out */
01702 );
01703 
01704 typedef enum
01705 {
01706     VADecodeSliceMissing            = 0,
01707     VADecodeMBError                 = 1,
01708 } VADecodeErrorType;
01709 
01710 /*
01711  * Client calls vaQuerySurfaceError with VA_STATUS_ERROR_DECODING_ERROR, server side returns
01712  * an array of structure VASurfaceDecodeMBErrors, and the array is terminated by setting status=-1
01713 */
01714 typedef struct _VASurfaceDecodeMBErrors
01715 {
01716     int status; /* 1 if hardware has returned detailed info below, -1 means this record is invalid */
01717     unsigned int start_mb; /* start mb address with errors */
01718     unsigned int end_mb;  /* end mb address with errors */
01719     VADecodeErrorType decode_error_type;
01720 } VASurfaceDecodeMBErrors;
01721 
01722 /*
01723  * After the application gets VA_STATUS_ERROR_DECODING_ERROR after calling vaSyncSurface(),
01724  * it can call vaQuerySurfaceError to find out further details on the particular error.
01725  * VA_STATUS_ERROR_DECODING_ERROR should be passed in as "error_status",
01726  * upon the return, error_info will point to an array of _VASurfaceDecodeMBErrors structure,
01727  * which is allocated and filled by libVA with detailed information on the missing or error macroblocks.
01728  * The array is terminated if "status==-1" is detected.
01729  */
01730 VAStatus vaQuerySurfaceError(
01731     VADisplay dpy,
01732     VASurfaceID surface,
01733     VAStatus error_status,
01734     void **error_info
01735 );
01736 
01737 /*
01738  * Images and Subpictures
01739  * VAImage is used to either get the surface data to client memory, or 
01740  * to copy image data in client memory to a surface. 
01741  * Both images, subpictures and surfaces follow the same 2D coordinate system where origin 
01742  * is at the upper left corner with positive X to the right and positive Y down
01743  */
01744 #define VA_FOURCC(ch0, ch1, ch2, ch3) \
01745     ((unsigned long)(unsigned char) (ch0) | ((unsigned long)(unsigned char) (ch1) << 8) | \
01746     ((unsigned long)(unsigned char) (ch2) << 16) | ((unsigned long)(unsigned char) (ch3) << 24 ))
01747 
01748 /* a few common FourCCs */
01749 #define VA_FOURCC_NV12          0x3231564E
01750 #define VA_FOURCC_AI44          0x34344149
01751 #define VA_FOURCC_RGBA          0x41424752
01752 #define VA_FOURCC_BGRA          0x41524742
01753 #define VA_FOURCC_UYVY          0x59565955
01754 #define VA_FOURCC_YUY2          0x32595559
01755 #define VA_FOURCC_AYUV          0x56555941
01756 #define VA_FOURCC_NV11          0x3131564e
01757 #define VA_FOURCC_YV12          0x32315659
01758 #define VA_FOURCC_P208          0x38303250
01759 #define VA_FOURCC_IYUV          0x56555949
01760 
01761 /* byte order */
01762 #define VA_LSB_FIRST            1
01763 #define VA_MSB_FIRST            2
01764 
01765 typedef struct _VAImageFormat
01766 {
01767     unsigned int        fourcc;
01768     unsigned int        byte_order; /* VA_LSB_FIRST, VA_MSB_FIRST */
01769     unsigned int        bits_per_pixel;
01770     /* for RGB formats */
01771     unsigned int        depth; /* significant bits per pixel */
01772     unsigned int        red_mask;
01773     unsigned int        green_mask;
01774     unsigned int        blue_mask;
01775     unsigned int        alpha_mask;
01776 } VAImageFormat;
01777 
01778 typedef VAGenericID VAImageID;
01779 
01780 typedef struct _VAImage
01781 {
01782     VAImageID           image_id; /* uniquely identify this image */
01783     VAImageFormat       format;
01784     VABufferID          buf;    /* image data buffer */
01785     /*
01786      * Image data will be stored in a buffer of type VAImageBufferType to facilitate
01787      * data store on the server side for optimal performance. The buffer will be 
01788      * created by the CreateImage function, and proper storage allocated based on the image
01789      * size and format. This buffer is managed by the library implementation, and 
01790      * accessed by the client through the buffer Map/Unmap functions.
01791      */
01792     unsigned short      width; 
01793     unsigned short      height;
01794     unsigned int        data_size;
01795     unsigned int        num_planes;     /* can not be greater than 3 */
01796     /* 
01797      * An array indicating the scanline pitch in bytes for each plane.
01798      * Each plane may have a different pitch. Maximum 3 planes for planar formats
01799      */
01800     unsigned int        pitches[3];
01801     /* 
01802      * An array indicating the byte offset from the beginning of the image data 
01803      * to the start of each plane.
01804      */
01805     unsigned int        offsets[3];
01806 
01807     /* The following fields are only needed for paletted formats */
01808     int num_palette_entries;   /* set to zero for non-palette images */
01809     /* 
01810      * Each component is one byte and entry_bytes indicates the number of components in 
01811      * each entry (eg. 3 for YUV palette entries). set to zero for non-palette images   
01812      */
01813     int entry_bytes; 
01814     /*
01815      * An array of ascii characters describing the order of the components within the bytes.
01816      * Only entry_bytes characters of the string are used.
01817      */
01818     char component_order[4];
01819 } VAImage;
01820 
01821 /* Get maximum number of image formats supported by the implementation */
01822 int vaMaxNumImageFormats (
01823     VADisplay dpy
01824 );
01825 
01826 /* 
01827  * Query supported image formats 
01828  * The caller must provide a "format_list" array that can hold at
01829  * least vaMaxNumImageFormats() entries. The actual number of formats
01830  * returned in "format_list" is returned in "num_formats".
01831  */
01832 VAStatus vaQueryImageFormats (
01833     VADisplay dpy,
01834     VAImageFormat *format_list, /* out */
01835     int *num_formats            /* out */
01836 );
01837 
01838 /* 
01839  * Create a VAImage structure
01840  * The width and height fields returned in the VAImage structure may get 
01841  * enlarged for some YUV formats. Upon return from this function, 
01842  * image->buf has been created and proper storage allocated by the library. 
01843  * The client can access the image through the Map/Unmap calls.
01844  */
01845 VAStatus vaCreateImage (
01846     VADisplay dpy,
01847     VAImageFormat *format,
01848     int width,
01849     int height,
01850     VAImage *image      /* out */
01851 );
01852 
01853 /*
01854  * Should call DestroyImage before destroying the surface it is bound to
01855  */
01856 VAStatus vaDestroyImage (
01857     VADisplay dpy,
01858     VAImageID image
01859 );
01860 
01861 VAStatus vaSetImagePalette (
01862     VADisplay dpy,
01863     VAImageID image,
01864     /* 
01865      * pointer to an array holding the palette data.  The size of the array is 
01866      * num_palette_entries * entry_bytes in size.  The order of the components 
01867      * in the palette is described by the component_order in VAImage struct    
01868      */
01869     unsigned char *palette 
01870 );
01871 
01872 /*
01873  * Retrive surface data into a VAImage
01874  * Image must be in a format supported by the implementation
01875  */
01876 VAStatus vaGetImage (
01877     VADisplay dpy,
01878     VASurfaceID surface,
01879     int x,      /* coordinates of the upper left source pixel */
01880     int y,
01881     unsigned int width, /* width and height of the region */
01882     unsigned int height,
01883     VAImageID image
01884 );
01885 
01886 /*
01887  * Copy data from a VAImage to a surface
01888  * Image must be in a format supported by the implementation
01889  * Returns a VA_STATUS_ERROR_SURFACE_BUSY if the surface
01890  * shouldn't be rendered into when this is called
01891  */
01892 VAStatus vaPutImage (
01893     VADisplay dpy,
01894     VASurfaceID surface,
01895     VAImageID image,
01896     int src_x,
01897     int src_y,
01898     unsigned int src_width,
01899     unsigned int src_height,
01900     int dest_x,
01901     int dest_y,
01902     unsigned int dest_width,
01903     unsigned int dest_height
01904 );
01905 
01906 /*
01907  * Derive an VAImage from an existing surface.
01908  * This interface will derive a VAImage and corresponding image buffer from
01909  * an existing VA Surface. The image buffer can then be mapped/unmapped for
01910  * direct CPU access. This operation is only possible on implementations with
01911  * direct rendering capabilities and internal surface formats that can be
01912  * represented with a VAImage. When the operation is not possible this interface
01913  * will return VA_STATUS_ERROR_OPERATION_FAILED. Clients should then fall back
01914  * to using vaCreateImage + vaPutImage to accomplish the same task in an
01915  * indirect manner.
01916  *
01917  * Implementations should only return success when the resulting image buffer
01918  * would be useable with vaMap/Unmap.
01919  *
01920  * When directly accessing a surface special care must be taken to insure
01921  * proper synchronization with the graphics hardware. Clients should call
01922  * vaQuerySurfaceStatus to insure that a surface is not the target of concurrent
01923  * rendering or currently being displayed by an overlay.
01924  *
01925  * Additionally nothing about the contents of a surface should be assumed
01926  * following a vaPutSurface. Implementations are free to modify the surface for
01927  * scaling or subpicture blending within a call to vaPutImage.
01928  *
01929  * Calls to vaPutImage or vaGetImage using the same surface from which the image
01930  * has been derived will return VA_STATUS_ERROR_SURFACE_BUSY. vaPutImage or
01931  * vaGetImage with other surfaces is supported.
01932  *
01933  * An image created with vaDeriveImage should be freed with vaDestroyImage. The
01934  * image and image buffer structures will be destroyed; however, the underlying
01935  * surface will remain unchanged until freed with vaDestroySurfaces.
01936  */
01937 VAStatus vaDeriveImage (
01938     VADisplay dpy,
01939     VASurfaceID surface,
01940     VAImage *image      /* out */
01941 );
01942 
01943 /*
01944  * Subpictures 
01945  * Subpicture is a special type of image that can be blended 
01946  * with a surface during vaPutSurface(). Subpicture can be used to render
01947  * DVD sub-titles or closed captioning text etc.  
01948  */
01949 
01950 typedef VAGenericID VASubpictureID;
01951 
01952 /* Get maximum number of subpicture formats supported by the implementation */
01953 int vaMaxNumSubpictureFormats (
01954     VADisplay dpy
01955 );
01956 
01957 /* flags for subpictures */
01958 #define VA_SUBPICTURE_CHROMA_KEYING                     0x0001
01959 #define VA_SUBPICTURE_GLOBAL_ALPHA                      0x0002
01960 #define VA_SUBPICTURE_DESTINATION_IS_SCREEN_COORD       0x0004
01961 /* 
01962  * Query supported subpicture formats 
01963  * The caller must provide a "format_list" array that can hold at
01964  * least vaMaxNumSubpictureFormats() entries. The flags arrary holds the flag 
01965  * for each format to indicate additional capabilities for that format. The actual 
01966  * number of formats returned in "format_list" is returned in "num_formats".
01967  *  flags: returned value to indicate addtional capabilities
01968  *         VA_SUBPICTURE_CHROMA_KEYING - supports chroma-keying
01969  *         VA_SUBPICTURE_GLOBAL_ALPHA - supports global alpha
01970  *         VA_SUBPICTURE_DESTINATION_IS_SCREEN_COORD - supports unscaled screen relative subpictures for On Screen Display
01971  */
01972 
01973 VAStatus vaQuerySubpictureFormats (
01974     VADisplay dpy,
01975     VAImageFormat *format_list, /* out */
01976     unsigned int *flags,        /* out */
01977     unsigned int *num_formats   /* out */
01978 );
01979 
01980 /* 
01981  * Subpictures are created with an image associated. 
01982  */
01983 VAStatus vaCreateSubpicture (
01984     VADisplay dpy,
01985     VAImageID image,
01986     VASubpictureID *subpicture  /* out */
01987 );

01990  * Destroy the subpicture before destroying the image it is assocated to
01991  */

01997 /* 
01998  * Bind an image to the subpicture. This image will now be associated with 
01999  * the subpicture instead of the one at creation.
02000  */
02001 VAStatus vaSetSubpictureImage (
02002     VADisplay dpy,
02003     VASubpictureID subpicture,
02004     VAImageID image
02005 );
02006 
02007 /*
02008  * If chromakey is enabled, then the area where the source value falls within
02009  * the chromakey [min, max] range is transparent
02010  * The chromakey component format is the following:
02011  *  For RGB: [0:7] Red [8:15] Blue [16:23] Green   
02012  *  For YUV: [0:7] V [8:15] U [16:23] Y
02013  * The chromakey mask can be used to mask out certain components for chromakey
02014  * comparision
02015  */
02016 VAStatus vaSetSubpictureChromakey (
02017     VADisplay dpy,
02018     VASubpictureID subpicture,
02019     unsigned int chromakey_min,
02020     unsigned int chromakey_max,
02021     unsigned int chromakey_mask
02022 );
02023 
02024 /*
02025  * Global alpha value is between 0 and 1. A value of 1 means fully opaque and 
02026  * a value of 0 means fully transparent. If per-pixel alpha is also specified then
02027  * the overall alpha is per-pixel alpha multiplied by the global alpha
02028  */
02029 VAStatus vaSetSubpictureGlobalAlpha (
02030     VADisplay dpy,
02031     VASubpictureID subpicture,
02032     float global_alpha 
02033 );
02034 
02035 /*
02036  * vaAssociateSubpicture associates the subpicture with target_surfaces.
02037  * It defines the region mapping between the subpicture and the target  
02038  * surfaces through source and destination rectangles (with the same width and height).
02039  * Both will be displayed at the next call to vaPutSurface.  Additional
02040  * associations before the call to vaPutSurface simply overrides the association.
02041  */
02042 VAStatus vaAssociateSubpicture (
02043     VADisplay dpy,
02044     VASubpictureID subpicture,
02045     VASurfaceID *target_surfaces,
02046     int num_surfaces,
02047     short src_x, /* upper left offset in subpicture */
02048     short src_y,
02049     unsigned short src_width,
02050     unsigned short src_height,
02051     short dest_x, /* upper left offset in surface */
02052     short dest_y,
02053     unsigned short dest_width,
02054     unsigned short dest_height,
02055     /*
02056      * whether to enable chroma-keying, global-alpha, or screen relative mode
02057      * see VA_SUBPICTURE_XXX values
02058      */
02059     unsigned int flags
02060 );
02061 
02062 /*
02063  * vaDeassociateSubpicture removes the association of the subpicture with target_surfaces.
02064  */
02065 VAStatus vaDeassociateSubpicture (
02066     VADisplay dpy,
02067     VASubpictureID subpicture,
02068     VASurfaceID *target_surfaces,
02069     int num_surfaces
02070 );

02072 typedef struct _VARectangle

02074     short x;
02075     short y;
02076     unsigned short width;
02077     unsigned short height;
02078 } VARectangle;

02080 /*
02081  * Display attributes
02082  * Display attributes are used to control things such as contrast, hue, saturation,
02083  * brightness etc. in the rendering process.  The application can query what
02084  * attributes are supported by the driver, and then set the appropriate attributes
02085  * before calling vaPutSurface()
02086  */
02087 /* PowerVR IEP Lite attributes */
02088 typedef enum
02089 {
02090     VADISPLAYATTRIB_BLE_OFF              = 0x00,
02091     VADISPLAYATTRIB_BLE_LOW,
02092     VADISPLAYATTRIB_BLE_MEDIUM,
02093     VADISPLAYATTRIB_BLE_HIGH,
02094     VADISPLAYATTRIB_BLE_NONE,
02095 } VADisplayAttribBLEMode;
02096 
02097 /* attribute value for VADisplayAttribRotation   */
02098 #define VA_ROTATION_NONE        0x00000000
02099 #define VA_ROTATION_90          0x00000001
02100 #define VA_ROTATION_180         0x00000002
02101 #define VA_ROTATION_270         0x00000003
02102 
02103 /* attribute value for VADisplayAttribOutOfLoopDeblock */
02104 #define VA_OOL_DEBLOCKING_FALSE 0x00000000
02105 #define VA_OOL_DEBLOCKING_TRUE  0x00000001
02106 
02107 /* Render mode */
02108 #define VA_RENDER_MODE_UNDEFINED           0
02109 #define VA_RENDER_MODE_LOCAL_OVERLAY       1
02110 #define VA_RENDER_MODE_LOCAL_GPU           2
02111 #define VA_RENDER_MODE_EXTERNAL_OVERLAY    4
02112 #define VA_RENDER_MODE_EXTERNAL_GPU        8
02113 
02114 /* Render device */
02115 #define VA_RENDER_DEVICE_UNDEFINED  0
02116 #define VA_RENDER_DEVICE_LOCAL      1
02117 #define VA_RENDER_DEVICE_EXTERNAL   2
02118 
02119 /* Currently defined display attribute types */
02120 typedef enum
02121 {
02122     VADisplayAttribBrightness           = 0,
02123     VADisplayAttribContrast             = 1,
02124     VADisplayAttribHue                  = 2,
02125     VADisplayAttribSaturation           = 3,
02126     /* client can specifiy a background color for the target window
02127      * the new feature of video conference,
02128      * the uncovered area of the surface is filled by this color
02129      * also it will blend with the decoded video color
02130      */
02131     VADisplayAttribBackgroundColor      = 4,
02132     /*
02133      * this is a gettable only attribute. For some implementations that use the
02134      * hardware overlay, after PutSurface is called, the surface can not be    
02135      * re-used until after the subsequent PutSurface call. If this is the case 
02136      * then the value for this attribute will be set to 1 so that the client   
02137      * will not attempt to re-use the surface right after returning from a call
02138      * to PutSurface.
02139      *
02140      * Don't use it, use flag VASurfaceDisplaying of vaQuerySurfaceStatus since
02141      * driver may use overlay or GPU alternatively
02142      */
02143     VADisplayAttribDirectSurface       = 5,
02144     VADisplayAttribRotation            = 6,     
02145     VADisplayAttribOutofLoopDeblock    = 7,
02146 
02147     /* PowerVR IEP Lite specific attributes */
02148     VADisplayAttribBLEBlackMode        = 8,
02149     VADisplayAttribBLEWhiteMode        = 9,
02150     VADisplayAttribBlueStretch         = 10,
02151     VADisplayAttribSkinColorCorrection = 11,
02152     /*
02153      * For type VADisplayAttribCSCMatrix, "value" field is a pointer to the color
02154      * conversion matrix. Each element in the matrix is float-point
02155      */
02156     VADisplayAttribCSCMatrix           = 12,
02157     /* specify the constant color used to blend with video surface
02158      * Cd = Cv*Cc*Ac + Cb *(1 - Ac) C means the constant RGB
02159      *      d: the final color to overwrite into the frame buffer 
02160      *      v: decoded video after color conversion, 
02161      *      c: video color specified by VADisplayAttribBlendColor
02162      *      b: background color of the drawable
02163      */
02164     VADisplayAttribBlendColor          = 13,
02165     /*
02166      * Indicate driver to skip painting color key or not.
02167      * only applicable if the render is overlay
02168      */
02169     VADisplayAttribOverlayAutoPaintColorKey   = 14,
02170     /*
02171      * customized overlay color key, the format is RGB888
02172      * [23:16] = Red, [15:08] = Green, [07:00] = Blue.
02173      */
02174     VADisplayAttribOverlayColorKey      = 15,
02175     /*
02176      * The hint for the implementation of vaPutSurface
02177      * normally, the driver could use an overlay or GPU to render the surface on the screen
02178      * this flag provides APP the flexibity to switch the render dynamically
02179      */
02180     VADisplayAttribRenderMode           = 16,
02181     /*
02182      * specify if vaPutSurface needs to render into specified monitors
02183      * one example is that one external monitor (e.g. HDMI) is enabled, 
02184      * but the window manager is not aware of it, and there is no associated drawable
02185      */
02186     VADisplayAttribRenderDevice        = 17,
02187     /*
02188      * specify vaPutSurface render area if there is no drawable on the monitor
02189      */
02190     VADisplayAttribRenderRect          = 18,
02191 } VADisplayAttribType;
02192 
02193 /* flags for VADisplayAttribute */
02194 #define VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_NOT_SUPPORTED 0x0000
02195 #define VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_GETTABLE      0x0001
02196 #define VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_SETTABLE      0x0002
02197 
02198 typedef struct _VADisplayAttribute
02199 {
02200     VADisplayAttribType type;
02201     int min_value;
02202     int max_value;
02203     int value;  /* used by the set/get attribute functions */
02204 /* flags can be VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_GETTABLE or VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_SETTABLE or OR'd together */
02205     unsigned int flags;
02206 } VADisplayAttribute;
02207 
02208 /* Get maximum number of display attributs supported by the implementation */
02209 int vaMaxNumDisplayAttributes (
02210     VADisplay dpy
02211 );
02212 
02213 /* 
02214  * Query display attributes 
02215  * The caller must provide a "attr_list" array that can hold at
02216  * least vaMaxNumDisplayAttributes() entries. The actual number of attributes
02217  * returned in "attr_list" is returned in "num_attributes".
02218  */
02219 VAStatus vaQueryDisplayAttributes (
02220     VADisplay dpy,
02221     VADisplayAttribute *attr_list,      /* out */
02222     int *num_attributes                 /* out */
02223 );
02224 
02225 /* 
02226  * Get display attributes 
02227  * This function returns the current attribute values in "attr_list".
02228  * Only attributes returned with VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_GETTABLE set in the "flags" field
02229  * from vaQueryDisplayAttributes() can have their values retrieved.  
02230  */
02231 VAStatus vaGetDisplayAttributes (
02232     VADisplay dpy,
02233     VADisplayAttribute *attr_list,      /* in/out */
02234     int num_attributes
02235 );
02236 
02237 /* 
02238  * Set display attributes 
02239  * Only attributes returned with VA_DISPLAY_ATTRIB_SETTABLE set in the "flags" field
02240  * from vaQueryDisplayAttributes() can be set.  If the attribute is not settable or 
02241  * the value is out of range, the function returns VA_STATUS_ERROR_ATTR_NOT_SUPPORTED
02242  */
02243 VAStatus vaSetDisplayAttributes (
02244     VADisplay dpy,
02245     VADisplayAttribute *attr_list,
02246     int num_attributes
02247 );
